Lively Kernel

Development

License

Lively Kernel is developed under the MIT license.

Community

For discussing all Lively related topics we have a mailing list.

For reporting issues, please use our trac instance. We encourage you to also create a issue page that reproduces the problem. Thank you!

Webwerkstatt

The Webwerkstatt wiki is a place to try out Lively and develop applications. See our getting started guide for how to set up your own workspace and an introduction to webwerkstatt.

Setting up a local Lively installation

In order to use Lively you do not have to install anything. The webwerkstatt wiki can be used by everyone who wants to experiment and develop applications with Lively.

If you want to run your own Lively Kernel server or contribute to the core development, the following links will provide you with the necessary information to setup your local Lively environment.

  • Download installer for Windows or Mac OS.
  • Installation guide
  • Screencast: Installation on Windows
  • Screencast: Installation on Mac OS

Lively 1

http://www.lively-kernel.org/repository/lively-kernel/trunk/source/kernel/

We archived a svg based Lively 1 version of Webwerkstatt in a separate repository.
